topics.body: So I've been thinking about something a lot lately. I read a lot of manga. A lot of shonen manga in particular, and shonen manga puts a lot of emphasis on heroism. So it got me wondering, could I do that? Could I be the one to risk my life to save or protect someone I don't even know? Do I have what it takes to be a hero? I really don't mean anything by this I just wanted to get it off my chest.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
Man, after going to the gym for a while, I've definitely got bigger arms. I've lost weight as well!

Random Fact of the Day

Like the phrase
"With great power comes great responsibility."
Holds so true
If you have the ability to help people, you are responsible if anything happens, because you could have done something

I would like to think if I were in a position of power
That I would do the right thing

topics.body:
Arizona just struck down their gay marriage ban; we're now at 31 states and it covers 61.2% of americans.  There's five states right now that have appeals scheduled.

Strangely enough Texas may be the next state to legalize gay marriage because the ruling was stayed all the way back in February.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
So I found a thing on Antfish's tumblr that made me giggle.
[bq]*HOW NARUTO SHOULD END*
Its the last Panel and it pans away from all of the characters standing together. Then the Manga closes and you see Josuke was reading naruto the whole time and it was just a manga in the jjba world. Josuke looks up at Rohan and says “Dude this fucking sucks, you suck at making manga”[/bq]

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/544179886368724b172a0300#post_544179886368724b172a0300
[bq="SeraphimDawn"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/544175356368724d3ac90200#post_544175356368724d3ac90200
Ironic because Texas is often considered the Conservative Bible Belt center stronghold.[/bq]
Texas isn't nearly as conservative as republicans like to claim we are; it's a southern state, but it's not a deep south state.  Anyone that has lived in the deep south knows what I mean by this.  Shockingly Texas is the 20th most conservative state.  The top two most conservative states are Wyoming and Mississippi.
